citations.narrative:
On February 02, 2024, during a private animal tour a small child member of the public was photographed interacting with
a serval, cavy, and wallaby without sufficient distance and/or barriers between the animals and the member of the public.
The serval was observed to have access to a raised platform inside the enclosure to get away from the public during the
interaction but was not otherwise restrained. The licensee stated she is no longer allowing public contact as of February
16th, 2024. During public exhibition, any animal must be handled so there is minimal risk of harm to the animal and to the
public, with sufficient distance and/or barriers between the animal and the general viewing public so as to assure the
safety of animals and the public.
Corrected prior to inspection on February 16, 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.131(c)(1) 
   
Handling of animals. 
On February 02, 2024, during a private animal tour a small child member of the public was photographed interacting with 
a serval, cavy, and wallaby without sufficient distance and/or barriers between the animals and the member of the public. 
The serval was observed to have access to a raised platform inside the enclosure to get away from the public during the 
interaction but was not otherwise restrained. The licensee stated she is no longer allowing public contact as of February 
16th, 2024. During public exhibition, any animal must be handled so there is minimal risk of harm to the animal and to the 
public, with sufficient distance and/or barriers between the animal and the general viewing public so as to assure the 
safety of animals and the public.  
 
Corrected prior to inspection on February 16, 2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative. 
 
 n
